citation.article-title: Rhodobaca bogoriensis gen. nov. and sp. nov., an alkaliphilic purple nonsulfur bacterium from African Rift Valley soda lakes.

p.s: Genus description of Rhodobaca gen. nov.
Rhodobaca (Rho.do.bac'.a. Gr. adj. rhodos red (rose); L. fem. n. baca berry. M.L. fem. n. Rhodobaca, a red (rose) berry
Anoxygenic purple nonsulfur bacterium containing bacteriochlorophyll a and carotenoids of the spheroidene pathway.
Cells are gram-negative motile cocci to short rods, 0.8–1.5 μm in diameter.
Capable of both phototrophic and chemotrophic growth.
Member of the α-Proteobacteria with closest phylogenetic relatives among Rhodobacter/Rhodovulum species.
The type species is Rhodobaca bogoriensis strain LBB1T.
